fields.description:
If a user revokes a OAuth token. When the OAuth consumer uses this token after revocation, it'll receive a 400 'Request Line is too large (4221 > 4094)' after half a minute. (used endpoint /user/repositories)

I would expect the consumer to get a 401 or 403, in a few seconds.

Reproduce:

# OAuth consumer: Request a OAuth token.
# OAuth consumer: Test /user/repositories (it should work)
# Bitbucket user: Revoke the previous OAuth token
# OAuth consumer: Test /user/repositories (it should result in a 401 or 403)
fields.summary: Using a revoked OAuth token results in a 400 Request Line is too large (BB-6711)

fields.description:
Hello!

I'm a new Mercurial user hoping to use your (great!) service to collaborate with colleagues. I began a mercurial repo on my machine and hoped to sync it with your online service using the very clearly-written wizard (specifically, the "Import an existing repository" link).

The whole process went very well but I was unable to determine how to BitBucket my default repository. While your site clearly recommends editing my $REPO/.hg/hgrc file to make BitBucket the default repo, it does not mention the exact changes I would need to make to this file. I would (humbly) suggest adding the text of this edit (added below) to your "Import an existing repository" page.

[paths]\\
default = https://user@bitbucket.org/user/repo_name

Many many thanks,\\
Edward
fields.summary: More explicit wording in adding an existing repository for new users (BB-6563)

Initialized empty Git repository in /directory/path/.git/\\

*I was able to use the same key to clone a repository from GitHub just fine*, so the fact that it works with them and not with you confuses me. I really want to start use your service. So please, any help would be much appreciate.

I would suggest it to be implemented in BitBucket the option to delete\\
the logs from dashboard.

Wagner Martins
fields.summary: Allow events to be deleted from the dashboard (BB-6565)

fields.description:
Our organization has numerous teams and a lot of repositories. It appears there are only two ways to prevent a user from getting notifications (specifically on pull requests):

# Revoke their access to the repositories that they don't want notifications for -- this really doesn't work because we want them to have access to the code, but they don't need bombarded with pull request notifications.
# Turn off all notifications at the user settings level -- this really doesn't work because then they won't even get notifications for projects that they are actually working on.

Additionally, all of these notifications fill up the inbox very quickly and render it pretty much useless. You have to go through a page at a time and delete the messages to get rid of them. There should be an option to delete _all_ messages, not just the ones on that page. (More control over what you get notified on would also help mitigate this)
currently, I have to goto the issue detail page and click "edit" button there.

As far as I can see it is currently not possible to specify and/or change repository ownership through the REST API. Repositories you create through the REST API always end up in your own account.

It can be done through the GUI already (issue BCLOUD-4127), but obviously that is cumbersome and each sys admin wants to have that more automated when you need to set up several repositories each month in a middle-sized/big company.
fields.summary: Change repository ownership through the REST API (BB-6671)

fields.description:
Hi,

When creating a wiki page with spaces on title, like Server API, the URL will be Server%20API. But when adding a tag from another page to this wiki page (like this [[Server API]]), it creates a link to Server_API.

Kind Regards

The API apparently does not support branches that have a forward slash in their name, e.g. "feature/test". For example, https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/katoquro/test_repo/src/feature/test/ should return the contents of the "feature/test" branch of the https://bitbucket.org/katoquro/test_repo repository, but instead returns a plain text "Not Found". It doesn't work either when I encode the slash with %2F.
fields.summary: Impossible to get contents of branches with a slash ("/") in their name using the API (BB-6670)

fields.description:
If you have a pull request that is very large, the pr is placed in a state where it cannot be merged, displaying the message:

bq. It seems that some or all of the commits that make up this pull request have been removed.


If the pull request is too large it should still be possible to merge it.
fields.summary: Pull requests can't be merged if they are too large (BB-6522)

I have both work related and personal repositories on Bitbucket and have configured two email addresses on my account. It would be really nice if it was possible to select which email address to use per repository, because now I have three choices:

* Receive work email in my personal inbox
* Receive personal email in my work inbox
* Juggle two separate accounts

None of these choices seem optimal.

It's really hard to tell which items in the inbox are read or not. The background color doesn't really differentiate well - I always suspect that the darker ones are unread.

It would be awesome if you used a more vivid color for the background or (even better) just included a simple circle indicator in the line next to unread mail.

Thanks in advance and make Bitbucket rock!

fields.description:
Hi,

This is my last try to keep using Bitbucket, I already reported this bug:

According to my Recent Activity I did commit 15min ago or so. But when I look at the Commits page, there are only commits of 3 days ago. When I directly click on the changeset link in the Recent Activity, I also get 404.

It seems like Bitbucket KNOWS that I pushed my changes but somehow can't FIND the commit. Even your API returns NULL (according to FTPLOY).

If that's the case, how can you tell that I committed 15min ago?

Regards,\\
Calvin

Thx for a great service and send my regards to the team!

/ Erik

When I click the "visit the email page" link, I go to this URL http://git.airjs.com/account/user/jeffairjs/email/ which is a 404 page.

Now, when I visit https://bitbucket.org/airjs, I don't see the yellow warning message at all.

Thanks!

fields.description:
I stripped my repository: https://bitbucket.org/viniciuskneves/rotas_onibus

Now I can't use it anymore.

I'm getting this message:

This repository is currently being stripped. Please wait for a moment and then refresh this page or go to the repository overview.
I keep getting "dead link" error whenever I try to add an issue.
When trying to change the logo of an project, the file-selection dialog opens, but afterwards only some kind of placeholder image appears, not the one i've uploaded.

Imagine spending 30mins writing a comment on an issue, and pressing ESC (because vim users do that all the time), only to find your entire comment was deleted! And there is no way to get it back!

This is the worst keyboard shortcut I have ever seen in my entire life.

Whoever made it needs a serious spanking (preferably by a vim user).

Please remove this keyboard shortcut.

I recently left a company, and no longer have access to the rpos on the team account, however they still appear in my repository list on my homepage. When I click on the links, I simply get a "access denied" and nothing else, so I can't even unfollow them. There is also no option to follow/unfollow a repo from the Bitbucket api that I can find.
Repo: https://bitbucket.org/Tenebrous/run

http://bugbucket-rbfve6jh.dotcloud.com
